abstract: Federal authorities on Wednesday arrested a man suspected of mailing pipe bombs and threatening letters to two mutual fund companies three months ago in an attempt to manipulate stock prices. The man, John P. Tomkins, of Dubuque, Iowa, is accused of mailing the packages to Janus Capital Group in Denver and American Century Investments in Kansas City, Mo., according to the United States attorney in Chicago, Patrick J. Fitzgerald.
